Author: Lorena Zeilman
Body:
I was hesitant to order from a company I had never heard of in the other side of the country.  I will share my personal experience with you. 

The pros:
Bob was extremely responsive.  You don't find that kind of customer service anymore in this day and age.  The work done is simply gorgeous. It is MADE IN THE USA.  You get a real life person on the phone every time.  They are excellent communicators!!  

The cons (if I can even call it that): one of my panels was cut too short.  It is unclear how that happened (fluke in production, someone typed in the wrong measurement?). I got on the phone with Bob, and he had the correct size in production the following day.  I had to pay for shipping, which was not a lot for just 1 panel.  This did push my office remodel back by 1.5 weeks.  But honestly, I was so happy with Bob's personal attention and customer service skills, that I didn't mind too much about the delay.

Wainscoting America has their job dialed down to a science. From customer service, to packaging, to shipping, production, etc.  Even with the mishap in size for that one panel, I believe they did an AMAZING job for getting this all done remotely and designing the exact panels that I wished to have without ever entering my property.   Simply put, they are the best at what they do.  I searched far and wide for custom wainscoting - these guys are it!!  

If you are nervous like I was in the beginning, don't be.  Wainscoting America will hold your hand and help create the beautiful project you have in mind.
Heading: Best Customer Service I've Ever Had

Body: I measured original wainscoting in my older house and recreated an updated version of it on WA's website for a newly renovated room.  I was worried that I'd make a mistake (I'm not an architect or designer), but I followed the instructions on the website and after a lot of measure-twice, type-once, I submitted my order.  The pieces came on time (the shipping company was supposed to call me with a delivery window, but just showed up, but that's not WA's fault) and they look great installed and painted.  They gave character and warmth to a new construction room so it blended better with the rest of the old house.
Heading: I did it myself, and it looks great!

Body: Deb was the best. Helped with making sure my measurements where correct, helped sizing panels to accommodate the outlets. Came out perfect.

Author: Michael Eisele
Body: OK, so this was my second project with Wainscoting America.  The on-line design tool is great, the product is first-class and the installation was easy.  You do need to measure really, really accurately to avoid a lot of trimming, but if you do have to make some adjustments, it's not all that difficult.  I did learn that no matter how straight and flat your walls and floors look, they're not really straight and flat.  There are some installation tricks (like using shims) that you'll learn quickly.  If you do the installation carefully, the seams are invisible; the panels are carefully machined to go together precisely.  These people know what they're doing and are happy to help you with your planning - just call them.  I'm a happy customer and already planning a third project.
Heading: I love this product.

Body: This company was excellent to work with. I went through the website and designed everything myself. This process was a bit cumbersome and ultimately did not pan out. However when I called to speak with them everything changed. Deb took over and designed the whole space, her professionalism and quick responses more than made up for the initial experience trying to do it on my own. This product cut my install time from months to days. It made my life easier and really saved my painter a lot of time. In turn saving my customer money and most importantly, the home owner is blown away.
Heading: Worth every penny!

Body:
I was attempting to build my own 12x12 columns, and my wife said can you do raised columns like the kitchen cabinets.  Did a lot of research and YouTube videos, and everyone said you need a 1/2” router table, and Bits. After looking at all the expensive items required to build 2 columns and never use them again seemed like a waste.  I saw all these great reviews, and decided to order them.  Easy ordering, and Bob helped me with the design.
I drove up to Connecticut from Jersey, and picked them up today.  OMG, they came out so GREAT, way better than I imagined.  Met the owner and he showed me the machine making the cuts, great guy, sorry forgot his name, but respected his knowledge and old school workmanship.  Overall it was Less cost and time, and so much better then Any human could do my hand.  Thank You

Author: Edith Pula
Body:
The materials are high quality and shipped fine.  It was particularly welcome when they called to check on the exact size I needed (vs. 46" in stock) then offered to cut the pieces to the 42" I actually needed.  What a time saver.  The shipping was high, but the materials are heavy.  They aren't installed yet (beadboard and top rails) but I can hardly wait to get them up.

9/4/2019 Update - installed these a few months ago and they look terrific.  It solved a multitude of issues with the lower wall in my 1930's bathroom where I had some plaster issues and took paint beautifully.  This application was bead board and top rails.  I'll consider a fancier application for my downstairs rooms as I get to those.
Heading: The materials are high quality and…

Author: Doug S.
Body: Excellent product and company.  First off easy to come up with initial design using their web tool.  Then I got loads of help from Bob refining my design.  My order arrived promptly via freight.  Panels were foamed into flat pack boxes so arrived in great shape.  Mill work on panels is nice and crisp. Panels installed easily on both level floor and stair slope over the course of two days.  Actually spent more time removing existing trim, finding and marking studs, and a bit of belt sander work to compensate for usual level/plumb problems.  A couple more days of putty, sanding and paint should wrap up the project.  My first thought was to fabricate panels from stock trim and I am so glad I went with Wainscoting America instead.
Heading: Excellent product and company

Author: Jose Dumenigo
Body:
My overall expectations for quality and achieving an elegant look and feel were exceeded due to the well thought out, highly engineered and structured product line (wainscoting, wall panels and approx. 18" wide tall fluted panels), including their top cap trim and baseboard.   The actual panels look even better than they do online.  In addition, the overall customer experience is excellent - great online design tool, design/dimensional layout help at time of order provided by Bob Muckle, and shipment within 5 days as promised. 

I cannot wait to install wainscoting in our circular staircase and back stairs.  We installed wainscoting in our dining room and wrapped 3x 9 ft columns, 2x 9ft tall fluted fireplace surround panels, a 8ft long bar, and the back side of a 21 ft kitchen island.  The panels were easy to install.  I am an experienced DIY.
Heading: Glad to have selected Wainscoting America

Body: I have ordered raised panel wainscot panels from Wainscoting America for two room remodels. The ordering process is easy and straightforward, the product is quality, the measurement sent are followed exactly, the turn-around and shipping is fast, and the product arrives well packed and in excellent condition. I have only had one damaged item( electric box extenders) and Wainscoting America reimbursed me immediately for the shipping mishandling. I recommend their product and workmanship without hesitation!

Author: David Strock
Body:
I was having an issue matching recessed shadow boxes that were embossed into the drywall from 20 years ago. The dimensions were not the standard of today and the ability to design the panel and sizing was key to making this work.
I recieved the panel i needed in great condition. Only took a few days to get here from time of order. Once installed the customer was thrilled with the finished product. The detail of the box edge wasnt exact but again i was trying to match something from 20 years ago. 
I will definitely be using this company again for future endeavors.

Body:
The product was shipped on a pallet and arrived in perfect condition.  The packaging was very well done although some of the finished panels had spray foam on the finished side.  In the how-to-video it stated that extra pieces of raised panel would be included so that the installer could frame out an electrical box.  It was not included. I've had to plane down some scrap wood to match the 0.320 thickness of the stiles. The product backboard is a bit soft and drilling creates a ragged hole on the back side.

Otherwise the product is as advertised and sized exactly as it was planned.
Heading: Product is as advertised and sized exactly as specified

Author: Tony Marucci
Body: Scott was the best, after I painstakingly measured and calculated to account for the 5/8" panel thickness, then wrested with the design of the specialty panel going behind the toilet and sink in our half-bath, I sent the measurements and some pics to Scott, and the next day he emailed me  detailed drawings with panel installation order, different options for the specialty panel, he  incorporatedthe existing HVAC register and electrical outlet, etc. I tortured him with almost daily emails, questions, etc. and every inquiry received a prompt reply or call that day if not within 24 hours. And all this was for an order that with shipping that barely totaled $850. My order arrived to NJ in about 2-3 days after placing order, panels are extremely high quality, 4.5" poplar base molding and cap rail are impeccable furniture quality knot-free wood that is almost a crime for me to be painting, would highly  recommend and will be ordering from them again when I get to my dining room project.  Thanks again Scott, you've got a lifetime customer and referral source for anyone interested in a high quality and reasonably priced product!
Heading: Great service, great product

Author: Mark Parris
Body: An excellent product.  Presumes a degree of carpentry and finish carpentry skill.  Design/order process is mostly intuitive and they answer the support line on the first ring if you run into a problem.  Orders come well packaged and mine was in fact shipped within the 5 business days they promise.  No damage in transit.  Wainscotting cuts were accurate to within 1/16th of an inch and slope for staircase pieces was spot on.  Bottom line: if you are confident of your ability to measure accurately and do basic installation this is a great way to save thousands of dollars on a classy, custom look.

Author: Bill Futral
Body:
First, I love the panels - in the middle of installing them now. There were two issues, neither stopped me from going forward. First, they sent the wrong top rail. I had ordered the smaller one which is more appropriate for my office, but received the larger one - not a real problem. At least one of the panels is a slightly different height (1/8 inch). Again, not a big problem. All lengths are as ordered. 
Panels came two in box, so each box is a heavy. Difficult for one person, you really need two people. Panels are delivered by a semi-trailer, so plan of unloading on the street.
I wish they would have sent a couple of scrap HDF pieces for positioning purposes. The HDF cuts really well - no problem trimming the panels. The HDF takes the primer very well - haven't painted yet.
** Follow-up: Within hours of posting my review I received a call from WA offering to replace the parts. Nice to have great customer service - so I am changing my rating to 5 stars.
Heading: Minor issues - love the panels

Author: Natasha D
Body:
I worked with Deb to make sure I took the correct dimensions because we had a several windows, doors and outlets/vent covers to cut out. She created the panel sizes for me based on their locations and worked to help me figure out what size panels looked best. She was very responsive and helpful, and after receiving the product and installing it I realize how many details she accounted for that aren’t obvious, so I would definitely recommend working with a consultant rather than just measuring for the panels yourself without help. It doesn’t cost extra. 

From the time I started the design to the time I received the wainscoting it took under 2 weeks. The delivery guy didn’t even consider hauling the crates up our 3 stairs on the stoop and into the house, so make sure you have someone able to pick it up off your front sidewalk to bring it inside quickly once it is delivered, especially if it is raining. (The boxes are fairly heavy and probably require two people to pick up unless you’re very strong.) I did receive a delivery window to make the timing of this easier. 

Once we received it, we had to trim all but two panels for a perfect fit with a table saw, but that was easy. We also had to cut out the outlet and vent holes with a jigsaw, which was also relatively easy (and they have videos online to help with all of this). We then cut installed the chair rail they provided and our own baseboards and shoe to match the rest of the house. The hardest part was painting/fine grit sanding/painting it, which took 4 coats (1 primer, 3 coats of glossy white) because it soaked into the wood a lot. The end product, however, looks professionally done and I couldn’t be happier with it. 

You probably should be reasonably handy with a saw (or hire someone who is) for install, but you don’t need to have much experience otherwise. The product is truly beautiful.
Heading: Beautiful and reasonably easy to install if you have power saws

Author: Dennis Oakes
Body: Ordered the remaining material for the living room.  When ordering shipping via freight was the one question mark in the process.  The material arrived with two boxes broken due to the stapping but with the excellent packing with foam, the panels had no damage.  Installation easy with a pneumatic nail gun.  The only potential issue was priming the panels for paint.  DO NOT USE Kilz spray primer as the resulting finish is rough with small pimple-like bumps in the routed areas.  Must be the solvents in the spray can.  After a light sanding with 220 grit paper, these disappeared.  The next panel I used Kilz original primer from the can and brush.  Much better results and no sanding required.
Heading: Great product if you follow instructions

Body:
I was very pleased with the product.  Everything was correct.  I did have an issue with the delivery though.  Seems its delivered in a 53' semi, which can have difficulty navigating small streets.  I had to meet the driver a mile away, and then load the panels into my SUV, which was just big enough.

One tip which would have been nice to find on the site, would be to consider ordering the panels 1/4" shorter than needed, if its part of an inside corner.  That way, if your wall isn't exactly vertical, you can still have the panel fit, and if its a bit short, fill the top of the gap with caulk and no one will know.

Author: Faye Jagger
Body:
As we were helping my son's family prepare for renovation of their Powder Room, I Googled for examples of powder room design ideas.  Suddenly, I saw a website pop-up for Wainscotingamerica.com.  As soon as I saw the nature of what you do and the panel options, I turned the research over to my husband who has a long history of  construction experience.  After accumulating the room measurements and other details, we contacted a representative, Deb Summa.  She quickly took us through the initial evaluation of our project and presented us with an estimate (including shipping).  From that point forward, we were amazed at how rapidly the process moved!!!  Deb's quick mind and absorption of our room, electrical outlets, recessed TP holder and the desire to center the vanity to the panel design moved the plan from "drawing board" status to production!!!!  We  were astounded at the ETA from Deb to the actual real time experience!!!  She was truly a joy and consummate professional . . . fully knowledgeable!!!
When the panels arrived we were immediately thrilled with the quality of the product!!  As the panels were then installed, we continued to be amazed by the precision of EVERYTHING!!!  The project was completed in time for a big family gathering held this past Sunday (July 11th).  Everyone was so impresssed.  We are now making plans to use wainscoting on the stairway from the main floor of my son's home to their finished basement.  We will soon be contacting Deb to take us through that!!!
It seems likely there will be several of our friends and relatives contacting you and your website regarding their own project ideas.
We are so grateful for the ingenuity and cleverness of your product and the fact we receive such rapid delivery from Conneticut to Indiana!!!
We are forever grateful!!!
Faye Jagger  (Project Manager at my son's home)
Heading: As we were helping my son's family…

Author: Nathan L S.
Body: I received the order in a very timely manner which was expertly packaged and paletted.  This company offers a very unique product, being able to custom order to fit your space is great, and the instructional videos on measuring are great.  The quality of the router, trim and accessories is excellent, requiring little to no prep work prior to finishing.  Pricing was also comparable to what you would pay to purchase non-customized wainscoting materials off the shelf, or to purchase the raw material and router yourself.  Time, cost and quality were all excellent.  The website was a little tricky, but all it took was a phonecall to figure out how to specify certain things.  Taking accurate measurements is critical and requires some thinking in many cases, so it's not a simple process and easy to get wrong, which of course is on the consumer and not the company, so measure a few times to be sure and pay close attention to the reveal dimensions around doorframes.  In my case everything fit perfectly and I did not fumble any measurements after studying their instructions.  The product looks great, the customer service is top notch and I will definitely do business with again.
Heading: Excellent communication, unique product offering

Overall, the design process is smooth, the product is great and the customer service is excellent. I would gladly recommend them to anyone I knew who was interested in adding wainscoting to their home.

Body: Shipping of the sample I ordered was very good. The sample was more than expected. Good size. Author: Dennis G.
Body:
I placed 2 orders with them for shipments from CT to FL.
I ordered Wainscoting to do a complete Formal Dining Room, an Entry Foyer, and second order to use for a BreakFeast Bar in the family room, so the panels would match our kitchen.

They custom made  the materials and the job came out great.
In fact, an engineer of homes, and another high end builder GC seen the job and paneling and said, it looks like it actually came with my 25 yo home. Of course this is MDF wood so I painted it white. (MDF cannot be stained as in wood stain)

You can't go wrong in dealing with this company. Customer service is helpful, and if you need a status, they actually leave their office chair and go into the manufacturing facility to check provide you a status.

Of course, take your time in measuring for panels, allow for over lays in corners so your trimming will be minimal. Measure, re-measure, and re-measure again and again, before you order. Mark your walls so you know where your panels will stand. View their online vids. Measurements come down to 1/16 of an inch, and the outcome really depends on your measurements. 

Yes I would use them again.
Heading: Great Company To Work With

Author: Bill Chase
Body:
I am very pleased with the wainscot panels I ordered. Normally I would custom build all of my own raised and flat panel wainscot or full wall panels but this particular project did not require that custom detail aspect so when I saw that I could order your product made to the sizes we needed for this small room that was going to be painted, I figured that it wouldn't hurt to try it. The panels look great and finished out nicely and most important the client is extremely pleased as am I. I will definitely look to Wainscoting America for any future projects requiring paint grade panels. The only issue I had was the shipper. When they received it at the Dallas trucking distribution center on a Monday they called and set up a delivery time for the next day. When it did not show up in the time frame that was set, I called and they told me that it was at their Salem Illinois center. I called that location and they said that no, it was in Dallas. I then called Bob at your office to let him know what was going on and was very responsive with calling the trucking company and got back to me to let me know they were working on it. So after a couple of days of back and forth delivery was set for Thursday morning between 9:00 and 11:00, at 10:00 I get a call telling me they have a shipment for me that they wanted to set up a delivery time for the next morning, which I then told them no, I will come to their distribution center and pick it up. Luckily the only damage was a small ding in one of the panels that took about 2 minutes to repair with a little glue and a clamp. Sorry to blabber on about the trucking company, maybe they just had a bad week but they certainly seemed to be incompetent and a bit like a bad Three Stooges gig, not your fault. Even my client was surprised because she knows the XPO's CEO. Anyway, long story short, Love your panels and definitely recommend you guys.
Thank you,
Bill Chase
B & K Chase Construction, Inc.
Heading: I am very pleased with the wainscot…

We are so happy with the results we are planning on doing the living room and dinning room and will absolutely buy from Wainscoting America again!
My one small complaint would be about the shipping company they use.
The shipping company called us on a Wed. and told us they were ready to deliver our wainscoting, however, we were leaving town on Thursday.
We asked if they could deliver the wainscoting later the following week, they said yes but they would charge us a storage fee of $100 a day. 
So we had to rent a truck, drive down to their facilities and pick up the wainscoting early Thursday morning. We were VERY unhappy with the shipping company and would strongly suggest Wainscoting America finds a new shipping company.

Author: DRA
Body:
Excellent customer service.  Without question the most responsive company I have ever dealt with.  

Some things I wish I'd known:

First, I measured the walls to within 1/16 of an inch, multiple times and with multiple devices, including laser.   And the panels supplied met with these measurements precisely.  But when put up on a wall and intersecting with the panels on the perpendicular wall, the "short" panels were too long by roughly 1/8 inch.  The reason is it is (or so it seems to me) impossible to butt up a panel to a wall so that there is no gap anywhere for the full height.  This apparently is due to the mudding and taping of the drywall.  My house is built of steel studs in steel tracks and 5/8" drywall, so I did not expect them to be anything but dead-on straight, square, and plumb. Quite wrong.

Second, I'm noticing wainscot everywhere now, particularly in the movies.  The best ones, the really ornate ones, seem to have recesses but also have a raised perimeter around the recess.  This is not possible with the milling operation that Wainscoting America uses.  This is not to say that the panels are not attractive, because they are.  Just not quite as attractive as those hand-built by a craftsman.

Third, I really wish they would have come already primed.  I would pay extra for that.

All in all, I am absolutely glad I bought from Wainscoting America and would do it again. We now have the most beautiful dining room around these parts.
Heading: Excellent customer service

Also I needed a piece that was 95 inches, so I ordered an piece that was 96 inches. Little did I know, that my mounding would be cut to 94” for shipping. This little tidbit should be made much more obvious to purchasers. Not wanting to splice the moulding, I ended up not using the moulding on my project.

The quality of the product was top notch. Keeping the issues above in mind, I would not hesitate using this company for future needs.

Body: The sales professional I spoke with (Bob) was extremely helpful over the course of several calls, even to the extent of creating the design to fit the parameters of my project.  The quality of the materials was very good.  The price paid for the materials was fair.  Unfortunately, the calculation of the angle of rise (stairway) was slightly off, but it is not noticeable enough to be a problem.  My biggest concern is the way that the product was packaged.  The packaging had literally come apart by the time the product was delivered to my home.  Luckily, nothing fell out or was damaged in transit.  They could do a much better job of packaging.  All in all, the finished product looks fantastic!
Heading: Overall good experience, but with some concerns.

Author: Dave Heckleman
Body: I've used them several times and they are awesome to work with and the craftsmanship is great. Very happy with everything. Thank you
Heading: I've used them several times and they …

Author: Volker  S.
Body: They delivered on time and followed up before producing the panels to make sure design I submitted was correct. Would recommend them with no hesitation!!
Heading: Great experience

Author: Rolf Westby
Body:
Good product,  well machined and packaged.  Requires a fair amount of prep before painting esp. on the recessed panels.

Thought the water resistant upgrade was a little expensive as were the panels.
Shipping expensive too.

By the time I primed and painted the panels, I had a sizable investment into them.

All in all, a good product at a high price.  Not sure I will be ordering again.
Heading: Good product

Author: Dee Ann
Body: I needed a sample piece of a chair rail molding strip to make sure it would work with the planks in my older-model home which have a much larger lip/inset than what you can find in the big box stores nowadays. The staff was VERY helpful and sent me out a couple of small samples right away as promised. One of the two styles worked great so I will be ordering from these good people! THANK YOU FOR YOUR HELP!
Heading: Needed a sample piece of a chair rail molding

Author: Jeff Hock
Body:
When the product was delivered to my house the box was split open. I was real surprised the product was not damaged. It might have been handled roughly by Fed Ex. I am sure you guys would not ship it that way. My only suggestion would be to protect the product inside the box a little more robustly. Other than that I was very happy with the panals, measurements were correct, my project is finished and looks great.

 Thank you

Jeff Hock
Heading: When the product was delivered to my…

Author: Brenda Replogle
Body: We previously purchased wainscoting for our formal dining room, breakfast room and powder room. We knew we wanted to work with Deb and Wainscoting America for our home office makeover. As usual, Deb was simply amazing to work with. Everything went as planned and we took delivery of our new wainscoting approximately 2 weeks later. The hardest part is choosing the paint colors for our office. We recommend this company for their outstanding customer service and prompt delivery. Brad and Brenda Replogle.
Heading: Office Makeover

Author: Don Yarbrough
Body:
Pros. Great service. Good product. Quickly replaced a panel that they had manufactured incorrectly. 

Cons. Could be packaged in a crate to reduce damage during shipping.  One panel was discovered with minor damage from a fork truck. Our carpenters agreed the could repair the scratch.  The panel that was mis-manufactured delayed finishing by a week. The reordered panel was the only excuse our carpenters needed to pull off our job.
Heading: Good service, but...

Author: Steve Wagner
Body: I have purchased from Wainscoting America 3 times and have never been disappointed in the product or their service.
Heading: I have purchased from Wainscoting…

Author: M M Bundock
Body: Absolutely beautiful, perfect, measured exactly and arrived right on time!!
Heading: Shaker wainscoting

Author: C Kelly
Body: Had to reorder material and it was easy and the staff was very helpful.  My packages arrived by Fed Ex ground and the company called when one box was delayed.  All the material arrived as we expected and in great condition.  We were able to order 150 lf of wainscoting and it all worked out perfectly.  We were able to adjust the rails to avoid outlets.  Worked out very well.
Heading: Had to reorder material and it was easy…

Author: Larry Brewer
Body:
From design to install of product, I couldn't be happier.  

I had tricky spots in my design.  Bob Muckle at Wainscoting America was a great over the phone with recommendations and the final design he worked up for my situation.  

The product was packaged very well and shipped within 4 days of placing the order.

The product itself exceeded expectations.  While produced by CNC, the corners of the raised panels were much sharper and cleaner than expected.  They even cut the slots for and supplied the biscuits for joining the panels together.  

I'm already planning my next wainscoting project and will definitely be placing the order with Wainscoting America.
Heading: Awesome Experience!

Author: Tamara Sullivan
Body: Order came within the time frame promised.  I called with a question after receiving one of the 2 packages and they were very responsive, friendly and helpful.  Would recommend this company for anyone looking for quality, fair pricing and great customer service!

It will make your project go sooo much smoother.

I did the install and everything worked as planned and looks great.

Body: Some of the panels weren't cut to the desired measured size - one was off by 3/4.''  The special end cap pieces are very flimsy, break easily, and were not lathed uniform.  When you would try to line it up with the top cap - they weren't flush.  The lathing wasn't uniform in each piece - some at a angle, some weren't lathed all the way through, and some of the depths were different.

It truly has a Millwork feel and look.  We did our  stair case, Upper landing, living room an now the kitchen to finish off  our custom cabinet island. all are showstoppers, the window surrounds they designed for us are the focal point if the living room. Next is the dining area and family room.

The staff is also always just a phone call away!!

Body: We install the product in a highly used bathroom over 4 years ago. Recently had a leak in the tub unit which required the replacement of the unit. We had serval contractors come in to bid the renovation. I was amazed that all noticed the wainscoating with a favorable response   Everything from “ now that’s the real deal” to “so where did you buy the wainscoating”. The product after 4 years in the bathroom environment showed no sign of wear.  If you want a great product buy it here. If you want to replace it later go elsewhere.
Heading: We install the product in a highly used…

Body:
I'm not sure if my words can match my satisfaction with Wainscoting America customer service and their products. Diana was superb! Thank you so much 

Joseph Colangelo

Author: Michael L.
Body: My experience has been very good, their products are worth the money. The only issue I’ve had were a couple of small blemishes where the MDF didn’t quite hold together, but I was able to use it in a non conspicuous area. I would recommend them to others and plan on using them in the future. As a footnote, Bob called promptly and we talked about the small blemish in the trim. He offered to replace it, but I declined because I was able to work around it. And I really am impressed with this company and their product and actually have another order with them. High quality material, craftsmanship, and customer service! Not easy to get those in one company now a days!!
Heading: My experience has been very good, now more impressed!

Author: Mike Eisele
Body:
I love this product - installation was easy and it looks great.  The secret is to pay attention to the measuring and design instructions; you will save yourself a lot of time and trouble if you measure really, really accurately.  Watch the videos and get yourself the proper tools.  

I had a contractor bid $60/foot to design and install the product.  With some planning, I did it myself and saved a bunch of money.  I'm already planning another project.

Good luck -
Heading: I love this product

Author: Stephanie  F.
Body:
I decided to redo our basement's larger room to be a movie theater, having had zero prior experience doing anything like that. When I decided I liked the wainscoting panel look, I researched options for what was going to be the best look/easiest to install since I didnt have experience with miter/table saw tools or use. 

The Wainscoting America software designer tool was easy to use and the panels arrived cut perfectly and precisely. One of them arrived damaged but they sent a replacement out the next day with no hassle.

The hardest part was measuring the angle on the staircase but Deb at the office there helped me / walked me through a couple of the harder cuts. They may be a bit more expensive than getting wood sheets and doing it yourself on a miter saw/table saw set up, but for someone with no experience in that this was a fantastic, super high quality option. 

Great team, especially Deb, and the place looks phenomenal now. Very happy and I highly recommend!
Heading: No experience DIY'er - Highly recommend!

Author: Russell Downie
Body:
I am 100% satisfied with my wainscot selection. By the way, I learned the proper pronunciation as "Wayne Scott" and not "Wayne's Coat." Anyway, my wainscot experience with Wainscoting America began on New Year's Day. Yes, you read right. I called on a federal holiday with hopes of placing a rather difficult order (not difficult to them of course). After placing my order, I rushed to their tutorial websites on how to install, prepare, and paint. My only negative feedback is the low audio quality in their YouTube videos (I am partially deaf, so maybe close captions?). 

Nonetheless, I found their tutorials spot on! I installed, prepped and painted my wainscot to near perfection (I wished there was a way to load my photos as evidence to this fact). 

Once the panels were installed, I prepped the surface with MH READY PATCH, filled the gaps with caulk, and sanded it all down 220 grit sand paper. After sanding it all down, I primed and painted using Sherwin Williams Super Paint (Ivory, Semi-Gloss). I also used an additive/extender in my paint to allow for better residence time and to minimize brush marks. If you want to avoid brush marks, look up videos on YouTube titled "paint leveling" or "paint extending."  Also check out M-1 Latex Paint Additive & Extender to achive a smooth finish.  

Overall, I am thoroughly impressed with Wainscoting America. They produce quality products, have excellent customer service, and provide tutorials for novice DIY'ers like myself.
Heading: Quality Product, Excellent Customer Service!

Author: B.O.B. Construction
Body:
Wainscoting.

I am a General Contractor.

Thank you!

Author: John C
Body: Awesome people!  I called twice for help and both times spoke with a person. Very helpful. This is the only website I have found that lets you custom order sizes. This was the second time I ordered from them and I will do so again.
Heading: Awesome people

Author: Glenn
Body: Great product and service. Deb was very helpful. I will be ordering for another room soon. The delivery was also exceptional, I recommend this product.
Heading: Great product and service

Author: Michael Duffy
Body: fantastic company, service if great, they call if there is a question about ordering, the best
Heading: Fantastic product and company

Author: Dale Shaw
Body: Good honest company to work with. Quality material, exact dimensions from order are delivered and appropriate packaging to mitigate damage. We had a miscommunication with one piece and the issue was taken care of within 2 days with replacement. I will do more business with Wainscoting America in the future.
Heading: Good honest company to work with.
